intro: Cuphea pulchra var. corollata, commonly known as the coral cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves and a compact, bushy growth habit. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
